Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
Congratulations to all the winners on the https://minethechains.com/#CompetitionResults Christmas Mining Competition. 
Winners have now all been paid via !arrrtip bot withdrawals and tips. We appreciate your use of the pool and would love to hear your thoughts on pool improvements for the future. Please consider us for all your Pirate & Komodo mining. Check out the Pirate Discord #mining channel for verification of payments.

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: @Alright mainchain is active. Lumber is on the v1 Verus Algo 50 PoW / 50 PoS. The idea is to up the staking to 80 PoS / 20 PoW at a later date (when komodod is updated).

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: All pull requests have merged

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: Hashrate is holding around 600MH/s but we almost broke 1 GH/s last night

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: I myself am sort of a PoS purist, but I recognize the utility of decentralization and verushash is ASIC resistant -- at least for now.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
@Pool-Operator Please update your komodo daemon in your pool and post after updating is done. jl777 pushed an important bugfix update for komodod.
```
cd ~/komodo
git pull
./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)
# you may have to run this ^^ command few times until you have it compiles
cd src
./komodod stop
# wait some time for the daemon to stop properly
./komodod &
```
New version would be `0.3.3`. Thank you in advance.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: The Pirate website isn't pretty looking. It's in the process of being upgraded, which is much needed

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Asic mining isn't too different from gpu. A bit easier tbh, less electricity, less options aha

Author: Mink#9547
Content: Oh very cool thank you for the link - so what's its primary purpose? re: pirate

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: It's primary purpose is 100% ztransactions. Meaning there is no data in the block Explorer. Nobody can see how many coins your have in total, or what transactions to whom that you have conducted

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Zcash, Komodo and other coins have opt in privacy, and only a minimal amount of users actually use the features.

Author: Mink#9547
Content: Interesting, so from the ground floor it is basically untraceable

Author: Mink#9547
Content: both in and out

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Yep, exactly.

Author: Mink#9547
Content: any movement in terms of adoption for it? or is it still very early?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: The only transparent addresses are for Notary Nodes (it is also secured by dPoW) and for coinbase transactions(mining rewards) which can only go to Z addresses

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: It's only about 4 months old, and has a fairly big following at the moment. There is a lot in the works too. It's currently only on 1 exchange, but they have a couple others in the works, and they're looking into zSPV and Web shop plug-ins for commercial use

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: It is a pretty unique currency. It is completely decentralised as well. No premine, no founders rewards, nothing. There is a marketing donation address, and currently they are asking for donations which will be used for exchange listing fees

Author: Mink#9547
Content: yea that's cool! incredibly grass roots
